item.title: Docs: GPU Node Optimization
item.description:
Describes gpu node information and details provided by optimization strategy.

View node information

Click the GPU Nodes menu on the left menu bar to display the node page, as shown below.

The node page is divided into three areas:

  1. Cluster selection area: Used for select a cluster.
  2. Query area: Used for filtering node by instance Id, instance type and node name.
  3. List area: Displays node information, its current settings and recommendations.

After select a cluster, the list area will display node of the selected cluster scaned by Cluster Optimizer’s optimization strategy, as shown below.

The list area is divided into five columns:

  1. Node: displays node name, instance ID and region.
  2. Owner: displays information about resource’s owner, such as department, group and user.
  3. settings: displays node’s instance type, number of CPU cores, and memory size.
  4. Details: displays the information provided by the strategy.
  5. Action: displays the corresponding operations on the node

Adjust node

Click the Adjust in action colum above, it will open the Adjust Node dialog, as shown below.

NOTE: Currently, it only shows tips on adjusting GPU node. In the future, we will provide automatic action on it which can adjust GPU node’s settings automatically according to settting provided.
